title: The Draw Any Animal Book: Over 150 Simple Step-by-Step Drawing Sequences for Every Kind of Creature
features: In the 1920s and 30s, French artist Robert Lambry (1902–1934) created a series of charming step-by-step lessons for drawing animals for a weekly children’s paper. They were later compiled into a book
Les Animaux Tels Qu'ils Sont
(Animals as They Are) and now, almost 100 years later, these beautiful lineworks will guide you to drawing perfection.
Lambry breaks down the process of drawing realistic animals into a series of simple shapes and lines, enabling you to
recreate even the most complex creatures in just a few steps
. Use the no-slip, wood-free pages to
copy 100 wonderful animals
—including:
Big creatures, like an elephant, rhino, giraffe, and hippo
Big creatures
, like an elephant, rhino, giraffe, and hippo
Small creatures, like a snail, frog, butterfly, beetle, spider, and fly
Small creatures
, like a snail, frog, butterfly, beetle, spider, and fly
All kinds of birds, like a swallow, peacock, turkey, heron, and swan
All kinds of birds
, like a swallow, peacock, turkey, heron, and swan
Domestic animals, like a cat, dog, chicken, and cow
Domestic animals
, like a cat, dog, chicken, and cow
A range of wild cats, like a tiger, lynx, lion, and panther
A range of wild cats
, like a tiger, lynx, lion, and panther
Ocean creatures, like a whale, lobster, and seal
Ocean creatures
, like a whale, lobster, and seal
And more!
And more!
Indulge the temptation to pick up your pencil, follow these elegant examples, and learn to draw any animal the Lambry way.
description: Little is known about French author and illustrator
, who specialized in practical drawing books, writing in the 1920s and 30s.
--This text refers to an out of print or unavailable edition of this title.
